author: Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said the US economy’s neutral interest rate may not be much different than before the pandemic, given the structural factors that have kept a lid on rates haven’t gone away.
title: Fed’s Williams Says Low Neutral-Rate Era ‘Appears Far From Over’

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s postal service has announced it will immediately partially suspend deliveries to the US and its territories, after the Trump administration ended duty-free treatment for packages.
title: Australia Partly Pauses US Parcel Deliveries After Trump Changes

author: Julie Johnsson, Eric Martin
description: Korean Air Lines Co. plans to order more than 100 Boeing Co. jets, and also inked a $13.7 billion purchase deal with GE Aerospace, after South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and President Donald Trump met at the White House on Monday.
title: Korean Air Sets $36 Billion Boeing Jet Order as Lee, Trump Meet

author: Laura Bliss
description: Park rangers in Yosemite and Sequoia & Kings Canyon have organized in response to Trump’s attacks on the federal workforce.
title: Yosemite Workers Vote to Unionize

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni
description: Prime Minister Francois Bayrou called a confidence vote that may topple France’s government as soon as next month, prompting a selloff in French assets as investors hedged for more political uncertainty.
title: France’s Government Risks Another Collapse, Weighing on Markets

author: Justin Sink
description: The Trump Administration outlined plans to implement a 50% tariff on products from India in a draft notice published Monday, the latest signal that the White House plans to push ahead with the heightened levies as efforts to broker a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine appear to be stalling.
title: Trump Administration Notice Signals 50% Tariff to Hit India Soon

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Calm Before the Return of the Congressional Storm

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is working to halt development of an offshore wind project planned near Maryland, in the latest escalation of the White House’s war on the clean energy source loathed by the president.
title: Trump to Halt Development of Another Offshore Wind Farm

author: Erik Larson
description: A judge in Maryland temporarily blocked the US from deporting El Salvador native Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda, hours after President Donald Trump hailed the man’s latest arrest by immigration agents.
title: Abrego Garcia Deportation to Uganda Temporarily Blocked by Judge

author: Chris Strohm
description: A congressional committee is expanding its investigation into the sex-trafficking operation run by the late financier Jeffrey Epstein, including seeking an interview with the former US prosecutor who approved a controversial plea deal in Florida.
title: House Epstein Probe Sets Up Acosta Interview, Subpoenas Estate

author: Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump said that his federal crime crackdown will sully the records of contenders for the 2028 Democratic presidential nomination, drawing an explicit link between his deployment of National Guard troops and boosting the Republican Party’s political prospects.
title: Trump and JD Vance Attack 2028 Rivals in National Guard Push

author: Beatriz Reis
description: Tarcisio de Freitas insists he’s not considering a run for president in Brazil’s 2026 election. But the Sao Paulo governor is increasingly starting to sound like the candidate many investors want him to be.
title: Brazil’s Tarcisio de Freitas Talks Like the Candidate Markets Want Him to Be

author: Justin Wise, David Voreacos
description: The Justice Department appealed a judge’s decision that rejected President Donald Trump’s appointment of Alina Habba as the top federal prosecutor in New Jersey as unlawful.
title: US Appeals Ruling Blocking Habba From Serving as NJ Prosecutor

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump called for an end “soon” to Israel’s conflict with Hamas, even as he’s continued to back Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and declined to urge him by name to stop his military’s stepped up campaign in the Gaza Strip.
title: Trump Calls for Gaza War to End Soon as Israel Steps Up Strikes

author: Brian Platt
description: Dominic LeBlanc, the Canadian cabinet minister leading US trade talks, will travel to Washington to meet with Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick just days after Canada pledged to remove most of its retaliatory tariffs on US goods.
title: Canadian, US Officials to Meet After Canada Removes Some Tariffs

author: Airielle Lowe
description: President Trump says the US will be buying ships from South Korea, during a meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung.
title: Trump Says US Will Buy Ships From South Korea

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela vowed to reinforce security along its border with Colombia as President Donald Trump’s administration sends US warships to the southern Caribbean.
title: Venezuela Sends 15,000 Troops to Border as US Warships Approach

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he spoke to Vladimir Putin in recent days and that he believed the Russian president’s dislike of Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy is holding up a meeting between the two leaders.
title: Trump Says Putin’s Dislike of Zelenskiy Holding Up Meeting

author: Manuela Tobias, Nicolle Yapur
description: President Javier Milei’s top officials moved to contain fallout from bribery allegations against an ally that are weighing on Argentina’s dollar bonds amid a liquidity crunch that’s sent interest rates soaring.
title: Milei Team Tries to Stem Bribery Scandal as Bonds and Peso Sink

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni
description: France’s Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said he would call for a confidence vote on Sept. 8 in an effort to force political parties to take a position on the government’s budget proposals in parliament and head off street protests planned for later that week.
title: France’s Bayrou Plans to Call Confidence Vote Over Budget

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada’s defense minister says he’s confident the country has the capacity to send soldiers to postwar Ukraine if needed, pushing back against concerns that the country’s military is already stretched too thin.
title: Minister Says Canada Has Capacity to Send Troops to Postwar Ukraine if Needed

author: Heesu Lee, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump blasted South Korea for political instability, foreshadowing a potentially rocky visit by the country’s president to the White House to discuss its framework trade and investment agreement with the US.
title: Trump Blasts South Korean Instability Before Leader’s Visit

author: Daniel Flatley, Erik Schatzker
description: El secretario del Tesoro de EE.UU., Scott Bessent, tiene la atención de un presidente impulsivo, y los inversores nerviosos de todo el mundo esperan que siga siendo así. Una entrevista en exclusiva.
title: Bessent habla sobre aranceles, déficit y el plan económico de Trump

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign two executive orders Monday aiming to end cashless bail in Washington and nationwide, marking the latest move in the administration’s agenda to crack down on crime.
title: Trump to Sign Executive Orders Aimed at Ending Cashless Bail

author: Erik Larson
description: Salvadoran immigrant Kilmar Abrego Garcia has been taken into custody again by US immigration agents amid claims that he’s been threatened with deportation to Uganda, a country where he has no ties, unless he pleads guilty to human-smuggling charges.
title: Abrego Garcia Arrested by ICE Amid Uganda Deportation Threat

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: The Polish government warned on Monday that it will no longer be able to pay for the Starlink satellite-internet system for Ukraine after the new president unexpectedly vetoed legislation to extend aid for Ukrainians living in the country.
title: Poland Sees Its Funding for Ukraine Starlinks at Risk After Veto

author: Levin Stamm
description: Swiss Post will follow other countries in temporarily halting the delivery of goods to the US, after the Trump administration scrapped an exemption limit for imports.
title: Swiss Post to Suspend US Goods Shipments After Tariff Crackdown

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett indicated President Donald Trump’s decision on who should succeed Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is months away.
title: Hassett Sees Fed Chair Pick Taking ‘Another Few Months’

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s military government and a rebel group it’s fighting traded blame Monday for damage to an iconic colonial-era train bridge that connects the northern Shan state to the the second biggest city of Mandalay.
title: Myanmar Junta, Rebels Trade Blame for Damage of Iconic Bridge

author: Miranda Davis
description: President Donald Trump has called Chicago “a mess” and threatened to tap the National Guard to tackle crime in the third-largest US city, expanding federal deployments beyond Washington, DC.
title: Trump Threatens Troops to Fix Chicago ‘Mess’ as City Rebounds

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel said it’s willing to start withdrawing its troops from Lebanon if the government there follows through with a plan to disarm Iran-backed Hezbollah by year’s end.
title: Israel Offers Full Pullout From Lebanon If Hezbollah Disarms

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Norway’s Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store said he plans to spend $8.5 billion in aid for Ukraine in 2026, which would be largely in line with the nation’s contribution this year.
title: Norway Leader Plans $8.5 Billion in Aid to Ukraine in 2026

author: Heesu Lee
description: President Lee Jae Myung is facing his biggest test since taking office less than three months ago.
title: South Korean Leader Looks for a Hit With Trump

author: Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan and Bangladesh vowed to spur efforts to increase bilateral trade, investment and connectivity after the first visit by Pakistan’s chief diplomat in 13 years.
title: Pakistan, Bangladesh Boost Ties in Rare Bilateral Meeting

author: Wes Kosova
description: A national coalition of corporate leaders says monopolies in politics are as problematic as they are in business.
title: Businesses Don’t Want Gerrymandered Election Maps Either

author: Colum Murphy, Philip Heijmans
description: China condemned Vietnam over a report it had sped up island-building in an area of the disputed South China Sea that Beijing claims as its own.
title: China Condemns Vietnam Over Island-Building in South China Sea

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Hundreds of protesters gathered in Jakarta on Monday to oppose excessive allowances given to lawmakers, despite President Prabowo Subianto’s promises to clean up the ranks of his government.
title: Protesters Clash With Police in Jakarta Over Lawmakers’ Perks

author: Rene Vollgraaff
description: South Africa is losing market share in neighboring countries because of a lack of support for local manufacturing, ceramics manufacturer and retailer Italtile Ltd. said.
title: S. Africa Policy Is Leading to Industrial Decay, Tile Maker Says

author: Dan Strumpf
description: India’s embassy in Washington has hired a lobbying firm with close ties to the Trump administration and a history of advocating for foreign entities targeted by the US, just before 50% tariffs take effect on exports from the South Asian country.
title: India Hires DC Lobbying Firm With Trump Ties as Tariffs Loom

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland acquired a stake in privately-held Iceye Oy, the Finnish maker of advanced Earth-observation satellites.
title: Poland Buys Stake in Finnish Surveillance-Satellite Maker Iceye

author: Prinesha Naidoo
description: South Africa’s National Treasury and the heads of its top banks discussed the risk the country may be cut off from SWIFT, the international payments system, if US lawmakers impose sanctions, Sowetan reported.
title: South Africa Treasury, Banks Fear SWIFT Loss, Sowetan Says

author: Eddie Spence
description: Indonesia scrapped rules forcing miners to sell coal and minerals at government-determined levels after buyers pushed back against a system introduced earlier this year.
title: Indonesia Scraps Coal Pricing Rules After Pushback From Buyers

author: Swati Pandey
description: US President Donald Trump berated NBC and ABC as “two of the worst and most biased networks in history,” adding he’d support the FCC in revoking licenses to their television stations.
title: Trump Threatens NBC, ABC Licenses Over News Coverage

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s approval ratings surged in local media polls ahead of a verdict on last month’s election performance that could determine his future as leader.
title: Japan PM Ishiba’s Ratings Jump Ahead of Key Election Review
